info.about: About me this is a paragraph

experience.title: Web Accessibility Lead - Sept ‘22 - Present
description: Lead accessibility strategy for ITHAKA's Product & Design including JSTOR, Portico, & ITHAKA S&R.
Partner with participant and user support service teams in responding to requests about our current Section 508 and WCAG compliance.
Conduct accessibility training for content creators, designers, front-end engineers, and quality assurance team members.
Perform accessibility audits as part of our VPAT/ACR authoring as well as alongside product teams within the software delivery lifecycle.

experience.title: Accessibility Consultant - Aug ‘19 - Sept ‘22
description: Main accessibility point of contact for  Enterprise Financial Sector clients (e.g. Banks, Insurance companies >1,000 employees).
Led accessibility initiatives for 15+ accounts, ensuring compliance with WCAG.
Facilitated agile transformations in accessibility, embedding with development teams.
Conducted accessibility audits and collaborated on remediation strategies.

experience.title: Front-end Developer - Nov ‘15 – Aug ‘19
description: Developed and launched 30+ websites using proprietary CMS with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP.
Integrated accessibility best practices into web development workflows.
Performed code review for accessibility compliance and provided actionable feedback.
Worked closely with designers and account managers to ensure accessible user experiences.

experience.company: American Association of Colleges of Nursing
experience.title: Program Assistant - March ‘13 – Apr ‘14 | Student Services Coordinator – Apr ‘14 - Jan ‘16
description: Built and managed NursingCAS database and websites
Maintained relationship with software development vendor

education.degree: Master's Degree of Social Science, Political Science, International and European Relations
education.thesis: Thesis - Government’s Role in Education on Citizenship Development - A Comparative Study of the United States and Sweden's Educational Systems

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Political Studies

skills: WCAG 2.2, Section 508, EN 301 549, WAI-ARIA, VPAT/ACRs, Agile Methodologies, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Git, Accessibility Testing Tools, Assistive Technologies (Screen Readers, Voice Recognition Software), Adobe Creative Suite.
